content: 0 with mc p3 *k3 p1 repeat from * to last 3 sts k2 p1 worked only once row 1 - cc kfb *sl1 wyib k3 repeat from * to the last 5 sts sl1 wyib k2 k2tog row 2 cc sl1 wyif p2 *sl1 wyif p3 repeat from * to last 3 sts sl1 wyif p1 sl1 wyif row 3 cc cross - kfb k1 *sl1 wyib k3 repeat from * to the last 4 sts sl1 wyib k1 k2tog row 4 - cc sl1 wyif k1 *p1 k3 repeat from * to last 4 sts p1 k2 sl1 wyif row 5-8 are the same as row 1-4 but they are worked with the mc row 5 - mc kfb *sl1 wyib k3 repeat from * to the last 5 sts sl1 wyib k2 k2tog row 6 mc sl1 wyif p2 *sl1 wyif p3 repeat from * to last 3 sts sl1 wyif p1 sl1 wyif row 7 mc cross - kfb k1 *sl1 wyib k3 repeat from * to the last 4 sts sl1 wyib k1 k2tog row 8 - mc sl1 wyif k1 *p1 k3 repeat from * to last 4 sts p1 k2 sl1 wyif repeat row 1-8 until you are ready to join the 2 ends approx 120-130cm 47-51 long measure either of the 2 long sides stop after a row 6 leaving the yarn attached until after blocking in case you want to make adjustments it s a good idea to block before joining because it s easier to block flat and also so you can check if you need to make any adjustments once you are happy with the length of the cowl break the mc leaving an end which is 4x the length of the row for seaming remove the provisional cast-on and place the live stitches onto a 2nd needle line up the edges then kitchener/graft together the 2 sides ashcroft 2026 - for personal non-commercial use only
